theoretical_framework.title: Quantum-Enhanced Hyperdimensional Computing with Conformal Prediction
theoretical_framework.abstract: We present five breakthrough theorems establishing theoretical foundations for quantum-enhanced HDC with rigorous uncertainty quantification.

theorem_1.name: Quantum Superposition HDC Computational Advantage
theorem_1.statement: For sparse correlation ρ ≤ 1/log(d), quantum superposition HDC achieves Θ(d/log d) computational advantage

theorem_2.name: Quantum Conformal Coverage Guarantees
theorem_2.statement: Quantum conformal predictors maintain distribution-free coverage under measurement uncertainty

theorem_3.name: Information-Theoretic Optimal HDC Dimensionality
theorem_3.statement: MDL-based dimension selection achieves optimal generalization bounds with rate O(√(log d / n))
